geninfo.para: There have been problems with the breather elements because of the incorrect width of the material used. This has affected engines with serial number 1324037 through 1368602.
With the incorrect breather elements, there have been reports of excessive amounts of oil coming out of the oil draft tube, after periods of high rpm and extended highway driving.

If your engine is within the affected serial number range and you are experiencing excessive oil carryover, you should replace the incorrect breather elements from the underside of the valve cover. Replace both elements with part number 1825688C1.

note.para: Part number 1825688C1 of the elements has not changed. The incorrect breather elements have been purged from manufacturing and parts stocks.

geninfo.para: If your engine is in the serial number range but not experiencing excessive oil carryover from extended highway driving and periods of high rpm, you should replace both breather elements the next time the valve cover is removed.

caution.para: To avoid engine damage, do not press in the middle of the breather element. This will cause a deformed breather element and may result in high carryover of oil.

step1.para: Install new breather element and do not press in the middle of the element past the cast ledge.

Place either end of the element as seen in Figure 1 and carefully push down on the end and sides of the breather element so the element rests on the cast ledge. When correctly installed, the breather element should look like Figure 2.
